subject: THAI
titleLong: Elements of Thai Language and Culture
description: The course will introduce basic spoken Thai and aspects of Thai culture to students intending to participate in short projects in Thailand.

subject: THAI
description: Gives a thorough grounding in all the language skills: listening, speaking, reading, and writing.
catalogPermission: Intended for beginners or students placed by examination.

subject: THAI

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: THAI 1102 or permission of instructor.

description: Continuing instruction in spoken and written Thai.

titleLong: Intermediate Thai Composition and Conversation I

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: THAI 1102 or permission of instructor.

description: Intermediate instruction in spoken and written grammar and reading comprehension.

description: Selected readings in Thai writings in various fields.

description: Reading of significant novels, short stories, and poetry written since 1850.

subject: THAI
description: Gives a thorough grounding in all the language skills: listening, speaking, reading, and writing.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: THAI 1101 or equivalent. Intended for beginners or students placed by examination.

subject: THAI
description: Intended for advanced language study.

subject: THAI
titleLong: Elements of Thai Language and Culture
description: THAI 1100 introduces basic spoken Thai and various aspects of Thai culture for short-term visitors.  Through active, participatory learning this course cultivates a working knowledge of the Thai language and develops a cultural "intuition" that is meaningful and functional for achieving a smooth transition and successful experience in Thailand.  This course is for students who are personally interested in Thai culture as well as those participating in university projects in Thailand.

subject: THAI
description: THAI 1101 provides a thorough grounding in all four language skills (listening, speaking, reading, and writing) with an emphasis on speaking and listening comprehension.  THAI 1101, along with THAI 1102 in the Spring semester, allows students to cultivate necessary basic language survival skills and fulfills the undergraduate language requirement in two semesters.
catalogPermission: Intended for beginners or students placed by examination.

subject: THAI
description: Continues to develop and comprehensively extends the four language skills acquired at the Elementary level (listening, speaking, reading, and writing).

subject: THAI
titleLong: Intermediate Thai Composition and Conversation I
description: Develops conversational skill along with reading and writing skills at a High Intermediate level.

subject: THAI
description: Develops advanced speaking skill with emphasis on selected readings in Thai from various fields, for example, History, Anthropology, Government, Economics, Agriculture, as well as other professional schools.  The readings are supplemented with visual materials such as video clips and films.

subject: THAI
description: Reading of significant novels, short stories, and poetry written since 1850 and other classical works.

subject: THAI
description: Continues development of necessary basic language survival skills (listening, speaking, reading, and writing) with additional emphasis on reading and writing in Thai script.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: THAI 1101 or equivalent. Intended for beginners or students placed by examination.

titleLong: Elements of Thai Language and Culture
description: THAI 1100 introduces basic spoken Thai and various aspects of Thai culture for short-term visitors.  Through active, participatory learning this course cultivates a working knowledge of the Thai language and develops a cultural "intuition" that is meaningful and functional for achieving a smooth transition and successful experience in Thailand.  This course is for students who are personally interested in Thai culture as well as those participating in university projects in Thailand.
catalogComments: The credit hour of this course does not count towards the Arts College language requirement.

subject: THAI

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: THAI 1121 or permission of instructor.

description: This beginning level course provides a solid grounding in all four language skills (listening, speaking, reading, and writing) with an emphasis on reading and writing. The aim is to enable learners to continue the process of thinking in Thai and learning to converse and "get around" in certain basic situations in daily life with an additional of basic literacy skill.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: THAI 1121 or permission of instructor.

subject: THAI

notes.descrlong: This course is part of the Shared Course Initiative and includes students from other universities using videoconferencing technology.

description: This beginning level course provides a solid grounding in all four language skills (listening, speaking, reading, and writing) with an emphasis on speaking and listening comprehension.  The aim is to enable learners to think in Thai and learn to converse and "get around" in certain basic situations in daily life.
catalogComments: No previous knowledge of Thai language is required.
